I really enjoyed this game, I would say that is both lovely and sad. It's a short story about mental illness, choices and friendship. One of the endings (the positive one) actually made me drop a tear.. for the character, for myself, for all the people out there who are afraid to share what is truly happening inside their hearts.10/10 really nice artwork.10/10 relaxing background music.10/10 recommend it.

After playing this game for a few hours, I'm really trying to understand why it has so many negative reviews. I see that a lot of people complain about the "one unit move per turn" mechanic, but to be honest, that's what makes this game challenging. It determines you to really plan your strategy and think twice about your next move, not just go commando style heads forward into battle. In my opinion, this feature should definitely be considered a plus to the game. Also, I like the constant struggle of keeping your squad alive, because once your men are killed, they stay dead and you need to spend a lot of hard earned cash to recruit new ones and upgrade their skills from scratch. This is also part of the challenge to use your head and tactics instead of jumping from tile to tile and randomly pressing buttons. Overall, I'm really enjoying this game and would recommend it to anyone who's a fan of turn-based strategy games, and of course, of the Netflix show.  GAMEPLAY ‚¶Å Interactive turn-based system‚¶Å Features two campaigns, switch between Narcos and the DEA‚¶Å Variety of units with special skills‚¶Å Story-driven prologue‚¶Å Good graphics‚¶Å Good mechanics

Armello takes a new look at the digital fantasy board game. It incorporates RPG elements, card games, strategy games, turn‚Äëbased combat, and dungeon grinding. The character art is reminiscent of Disney‚Äôs animated Robin Hood, with the weapon-baring animals conjuring the same nostalgia. It‚Äôs a fantastic aesthetic that adds a lot of personality, charm and uniqueness to the digital board game. Furthermore, an enchanting soundtrack does a great job of portraying the medieval setting.The combat is a mixture of random dice rolls, character stats, and any cards you have in your possession that you‚Äôre willing to play. It‚Äôs an ideal balance of luck and tactics.With the adventuring, the medieval fantasy setting and the fight for the throne, Armello invokes "Game of Thrones", "Magic the Gathering" and "Risk", and delivers precisely the kind of experience you‚Äôd expect from such a combination. The acts of cruelty you can perform are devious, the adventuring bold and heroic, and the twists as you flit between victory condition paths unforeseeable and sudden. It‚Äôs a great drama to witness and play. GAMEPLAY ‚¶Å Variety of heroes with unique abilities‚¶Å Hex tile design‚¶Å Day/Night cycle‚¶Å Huge replayability‚¶Å Four victory option‚¶Å Interactive turn-based system‚¶Å Cards‚¶Å Story-driven prologue‚¶Å Fair multiplayer ‚¶Å Luck and random number generator

Super dichtes, atmosph√§risches Spiel. Ich liebe sowieso die Kulisse - daher hatte das Spiel einige Pluspunkte bei mir. Viele negative Reviews erw√§hnen den fehlenden Horror-Aspekt. Dem stimme ich zu, es ist wirklich au√üer der grandiosen Atmo sehr wenig Horror im Spiel, man erschreckt sich eigentlich nie. Daf√ºr ist die Story aber rundum gut erz√§hlt, es wird nie langweilig durch diesen sch√∂nen Wald zu wandern und einmal kann man das Spiel aufjedenfall durchzocken. Ich wollte bis zum Ende wissen wo der Sohn dieser Mutter ist und es wurde durch Hinweise, kleine R√§tsel auch nie langweilig. Bisher auch in der Form noch kein Spiel entdeckt und daher ist das eins, das ich weiterempfehlen w√ºrde! Es muss nicht immer nur offensichtlicher Horror sein, es geht auch anders, leider passt das einigen nicht was man irgendwie nachvollziehen kann, es ist kein Resident Evil und kein Outlast - das steht fest! Dennoch gelungen und eine kleine Indie-Horror Perle f√ºr zwischendurch. Wenn man sich auf das Spiel und die Story einlassen kann, nicht zu hohe Erwartungen an den Horror-Aspekt hat, wird sein Spa√ü bei dem Spiel haben. F√ºr das volle Erlebnis, unbedingt in der Nacht mit Kopfh√∂rern zocken.

Sehr geiles Horrorspiel. Atmosph√§re, Grafik und Aufbau der Story ist wirklich sehr gut durchdacht und sehr sch√∂n umgesetzt. Ich habe das Ende etwas zu bem√§ngeln, es sollte / musste nat√ºrlich Tempo aufgebaut werden und schneller werden um es zum spannenden Finale zu f√ºhren, aber der Kampf mit ****** war sehr kurz und zu schnell vorbei. Ich konnte kaum mein Arsenal an Munition verballern und die ganze gesparte Munition einsetzen, da h√§tte man einen coolen, l√§ngeren Endboss-Kampf draus machen k√∂nnen mit verschiedenen Angriffsmethoden, vielleicht sogar mit anschlie√üender Verwandlung in ein gro√ües Monster um es danach geschw√§cht dann die Injektion zu verabreichen, dass h√§tte das Spiel wohl perfekt gemacht und ich w√ºrde das Spiel √ºberall mit 10/10 bewerten. Aber so ist es leider "nur" eine 8/10 und es hat  trotzdem wirklich richtig viel Spa√ü gemacht & extrem gefesselt. Ich bin froh das sich die Entwickler mal neu ausprobiert haben, da Resi 5+6 ja mit der Spielmethode immer mehr abgeflacht und stumpf geworden sind. Das Erlebnis wurde immer weniger nachhaltig, spa√üig und unnovativ. Hiermit haben sie sich wohl selbst √ºbertroffen und sowas soll erst mal ein Horrorspiel-Entwickler nachmachen, Hut ab! Oulast 2 ist ja leider durch flache, schlecht umgesetzte Story untergegangen aber Resi 7 ist wirklich gro√üartig. Ein muss f√ºr jeden Horror-Survival Fan!

Das ist definitiv das beste Horror-Survival-Story Game das ich je gespielt habe. Survival zieht sich durch die ganze Story, es gibt kaum Momente in denen der K√∂rper nicht vor Angst gezittert hat. Ich hatte noch nie so ein bedr√ºckendes, angsteinfl√∂√üendes Gef√ºhl bei einem Horrorspiel gef√ºhlt. Au√üer Outlast hat dies bisher noch kein einziges Spiel geschafft! Dadurch das die Bedrohung meistens um einen herum ist und nicht vor einem, h√∂rt das auch nie auf. Das ganze gepaart mit super tollen, interessanten R√§tseln und einer packenden Story erschafft es das wohl beste Alien Spiel aller Zeiten. Und vieeel Atmosph√§re & sch√∂ner Grafik. Es macht tierisch Spa√ü, es ist perfekt f√ºr Anf√§nger geeignet und f√ºr Horror-Fans ein MUSS! DAS SPIEL IST GENAUSO SCHEI√üE WIE ALLE ANDEREN LETZTEN TEILE ZUVOR AUCH!- Die Animationen 1:1 √úbernommen genau wie die schlechte Engine. Grafik ist wie von 2013.- Mini Maps- Man kriegt kaum nh √úbersicht weil direkt 5 Gegner vor dir quer durch laufen. Und alles viel zu schnell geht.- Einfach dumm drauf ballern reicht vollkommen aus.- Die Runden sind so kurz, ich seile l√§nger einen ab als wie die Runden hier dauern.3 Jahre lang daran gearbeitet? Ganz klar - das Zombie-Survival Spiel mit dem gr√∂√üten Potenzial! Miscreated wurde mitlerweile released, so wie man das mitbekommen hat? Meine gesamte Spielzeit bel√§uft sich auf die Alpha Version und den Verlauf zwischen den Jahren. Ich habe lange gedacht das sich bei Miscreated nicht viel tun wird. Es hat als grandioses Early-Access angefangen und sich stetig weiterentwickelt. Die Map wurde erweitert, die Fahrzeuge wurden verdreifacht. Animationen sind viele vorhanden, das Spielgef√ºhl √§hnelt sehr dem Vorreiter DayZ. F√ºr mich ist aber Miscreated definitiv gelungen, es hat sich viel ver√§ndert, die Entwickler legen viel Wert auf ein realistisches Spiel. Es gibt viele Funktionen (Hunger,Durst, Radioaktivit√§t, Lebensmittelvergiftung, etc..) die das Spiel wirklich interessant machen. Au√üerdem die M√∂glichkeit verschiedene Tiere zu Jagen und zu verspeisen. Die Grafik ist mit Abstand die beste die es je bei einem Zombie-Survival Spiel das in der Open-World spielt, gegeben hat. Dies tr√§gt sehr zur Amtosph√§re bei die wirklich unangefochten gelungen ist. Das Spiel hat mittlerweile ein fortschrittliches Base-Building System, dass mit Rezepten erweitert werden kann. Einzig allein was ich umst√§ndlich und bl√∂d geregelt finde, ist das Metall-Basebuilding. Die Teile m√ºssen gefunden und mit einem Fahrzeug weggezogen werden. Es gibt Metallschrott im Spiel, der sich super zum craften eignen w√ºrde, leider war es den Entwicklern doch wohl zu viel Arbeit da eine dringende L√∂sung definitiv notwendig war, bei den ganzenm Dieben, Pl√ºnderern die einem jeden Tag die Holz-Base aufgebrochen haben. Im Jetzigen Zustand ist das Spiel einfach super, man kann auch Anbauen (G√§rtnerei - Gem√ºse) und es hat sich wirklich sehr gut entwickelt. Leider k√∂nnte die Map gr√∂√üer sein, meiner Meinung nach noch zu klein f√ºr ein dauerhaftes spa√üiges Spielerlebnis. Obwohl die Map in anderen Spielen (zB. wie Infestation) auch in nicht allzu gro√üer Gr√∂√üe wunderbar funktioniert hat. Das lag dort aber wahrscheinlich am vereinfachten PVP - der nie langweilig wird. Es gibt ein extrem vielf√§ltiges Wettersystem (Sandsturm, Radioaktiver Sturm, Schnee, Sonnenschein-Regen,..) der wirklich sehr sch√∂n umgesetzt wurde. Ich bin gespannt was noch dazu kommt und bin bisher wirklich zufrieden, leider gibt es immer mehr Flops in der Richtung, weshalb Miscreated schon eine kleine Bereicherung ist.

Ein Spiel das mit viel Liebe gemacht wurde! Es macht wahnnsinig Spa√ü sich seine eigene Base aufzubauen und die Welten zu erkunden. Es bietet so viele M√∂glichkeiten und Abwechslung wie manch fertige Spiele nicht! Ich kann kaum glauben das es eine Pre-Alpha ist. Ich liebe dieses Spiel, diese magische Atmosph√§re und der malerische Grafikstil mit h√ºbschen Farben und sch√∂nen Kontrasten, ich hoffe das die Entwickler daraus einen richtigen Diamanten machen werden! Es steckt sooooooviel Potenzial drinnen, ich bin mir sicher das wird ein grandioses Spiel & ist jetzt schon einer meiner absoluten Lieblingsspiele aus dem Jahr 2016! Wie ein kleines "Happy End" f√ºr das letzte Jahr, Danke "System Era Softworks" f√ºr dieses wundersch√∂ne Weltraumspiel! Das einzige was ich leider bem√§ngeln muss... Ich hab im Spiel mit weitester Sichtentfernung ca. 60 Fps gehabt, mittlerweile (da man viel gebaut hat) muss ich auf kurzer Distanzsichtung bei ca. 25-35 Fps spielen...Trotzdem klare Klare Kaufempfehlung, wer Weltraumspiele mag sollte nicht lange √ºberlegen, sofort zugreifen!

Death is a great teacher. Failure in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is, as it always has been for this series, the greatest way to learn where you should have gone, what you shouldn't have done, and how you could have done better. Counter-Strike players spend a lot of time learning -- consequently, they are always getting better.Growth is an important factor in Global Offensive, especially if you're coming into Counter-Strike fresh or after a sabbatical. This is an extremely hardcore, skill-based first-person shooter, and it forces you to think differently than other modern shooters. If you‚Äôre a Call of Duty player, you‚Äôre going to need to change your play style to succeed here. Counter-Strike also tries developing into something new here as well, despite doing little to push itself beyond what it‚Äôs always done best. Global Offensive modifies old maps to keep veterans on their toes, and introduces official new modes that encourage different play styles for the first time in almost 15 years.For the uninitiated, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a small-scale, team-based first-person shooter with permanent death. When a counter-terrorist kills a terrorist planting explosives in a classic Defusal match, or a CT escort swallows a sniper round in Hostage Rescue, the victim is dead for good and doesn't respawn until the next round. As such, players on both sides must exercise skill and care. The bomb objective, meanwhile, gives everyone a purpose. Of course matches end when everyone on a team is dead, but a clever and coordinated terrorist team will give the CTs the slip, plant their bomb, and protect the bomb site. Between rounds, everyone spends earned cash on better gear and guns, and the cycle continues.Pieces of the Counter-Strike formula are dated at this point, but the superb heart and soul of Global Offensive is timeless. Teams are small, guns are lethal, and rounds are short. There's an addictive just-one-more-round quality to it, because there's a constant desire to do better than last time, to earn a satisfying kill, or to win in a new way. Call of Duty and Battlefield vets will wonder why they can't sprint to escape enemy fire or look down the iron sights to improve aim; Counter-Strike players will feel like they walked into their redecorated home. Certain map redesigns will catch hardcore fans off guard, but the changes are for the best -- the underpass choke point in de_dust, for instance, has a new escape route.Even in the face of genre evolution, Global Offensive doesn‚Äôt care to adapt. CSGO is so dedicated to Counter-Strike's aging ideals despite market and trend changes that it brute-forces its way to success. Part of what makes it such an engaging competitive game is that killing in Global Offensive requires a wholly different skill set than other shooters. Everyone is limited to what they have and can see, with little room for character modification or on-the-fly advantages. Running and gunning is a useless play style, even if you've bought a helmet and kevlar that round, to the point that someone standing still is more likely to score the kill. Walking, crouching, or standing are your best bets to reduce the inaccurate spray of machine-gun fire.Consequently, killing in Global Offensive feels good. There's a sickening sensation to dropping someone dead because you know they're not coming back. It's also satisfying knowing you used limited resources to play smarter than your victim. If players aren't watching corners, providing covering fire, or using smoke grenades and flashbangs, they're more likely to take a headshot from a more delicate and patient triggerman. The desire to experience that distinct feeling is a strong motivator to keep playing, even when you're getting steamrolled by an obviously better team.If you've played Counter-Strike before, Global Offensive probably sounds a whole lot like Counter-Strike. Like Counter-Strike: Source before it, Global Offensive exists simply to modernize the look of the classic competitive shooter, while doing little to disrupt the core form and function. At the same time, it does enough to color outside the lines of tradition to justify your time and effort.

For me, Terraria is a 2D Adventure-Story game. You start off as a simple human, overcoming many obsacles, until you can be the best dark or light magician spawning creatures to fight for you, or have the best sword currently in the game and slash stuff and be the king. You can choose your way in many ways. You can build, kill and even dig stuff. It doesn't have sotry elements, but killing the bosses one after another makes me do that by myself. The best part is this game is now alive again. It has had many updates since 1.2 which was the biggest update ever.Music - Awesome, suits the game in many ways. Favorite: Underground Mushroom Biome.Graphics - Very awesome, pixelated in a good way, the game looks much nicer in pixels than 1080p non-pixelated graphics.World Design - The backrounds are awesome as well as interacting with the world (breaking objects) makes you feel inside it.A.I. - The enemies are not stupid at all, they can see you. Amazing too.There's no story or cutscenes, because it doesn't need to. It's too much awesomeness for a game. If you're looking to buy it, please, check the 1.2 trailer on this page and you will change your mind.Terraria. Awesome game to spend your time, but better with friends.A masterpiece without the need of next-gen graphics. 10/10

This is a well made, stylized, team based first person shooter. Teamwork is needed to win at higher levels of play, though lone wolfing is fine on lower skill levels such as on most public servers. There are 9 classes to choose from. Each class has unique weapons and abilities that allow each to fill a unique roll as part of a larger team. This provides for a challenging and rewarding experience when faced against opponents of similar or better skill levels.There are two official modes of play: player versus player and 'Mann Versus Machine'.Player versus player is a mode where one team of players battles against another team of players. Within this mode, there are different types of maps. Each type of map has it's own objectives for both teams to achieve.'Mann Verses Machine' is a mode where a team of up to 6 players battles against waves of bots. Players collect money from destroyed bots. The money is divided equally among players in the team and can be used to purchase upgrades and abilities for the next wave of bots. The pay to play sub-mode, "Mann Up", gives rewards upon completing a "tour".In addition to the official modes of play, there are several player made mods that introduce other modes of play such as 'Versus Saxton Hale', where a team of players battles against a player playing as a character named Saxton Hale; 'Dodge Ball', where two teams of players playing as Pyros must airblast rockets and other projectiles back and forth in order to stay alive; 'Zombie Mod', where a team of players must make it to the end of the map without dying to zombies that are played by other players; to name just a few of the many player made mods available.In addition to game play, players will randomly receive free items from the game. Some of the free items given out are weapons, hats and crates. Hats can be worn by a class to change the appearance of that class. Crates can be opened with a key. Keys can be purchased from the Mann Co Store or from the Steam Community Market or traded for from another player. Most crates will list which items can be found within them.

Encore une fois cette ann√©e beaucoup de critiques n√©gatives, mais comment c'est possible, ce jeu est juste indescriptible ???Je m'explique :On a la chance d'√™tre consid√©r√© comme des joueurs de seconde zone car on a une version au rabais, genre m√™me un PC √† 3000 euros n'a pas le droit √† une version next gen et c'est super bien pour notre vie IRL !!!On a plein de vid√©os sur Youtube sur comment cr√©er son profil de joueur id√©al avec des nouveaux menus/stats et ben tout √ßa c'est pas pour nous, non non non, nous on a juste la mise √† jour des effectifs pour 60 euros merci 2K c'est tellement pr√©venant.Vous pouvez jouer en Hall of Fame et comme l'ann√©e derni√®re gagner des matchs avec 40 √† 50 points d'avance, tranquille on ne fatigue pas nos petits doigts tout mignon (ou biscornus) sur la manette, merci 2K c'est si gentil pour notre arthrose future.L'incoh√©rence des timings c'est juste jouissif, un lancer franc √† 99% ne rentre pas mais un lancer franc √† 49% lui peut rentrer, ben √ßa c'est super pour les chauves qui n'ont pas √† s'arracher les cheveux, merci 2K de penser √† notre cuir chevelu.Et je ne parlerai pas des tirs √† 3 points c'est une franche rigolade √† chaque partie !!!Bref je recommande apr√®s 93 heures de jeu, une fois la pilule aval√©e il reste √† peu pr√®s un an pour la faire descendre et qui sait avoir le droit d'√™tre consid√©r√© en tant que joueur par 2K.Et en plus j'ai chang√© la sonnerie de mon t√©l√©phone en bruit de pigeon et √ßa, √ßa n'a pas de prix.Bon jeu √† tous !!!

Apr√®s plus de 2000 h de jeu sur SWTOR je vais laisser un avis positif, parce qu'apr√®s tout j'y ai quand m√™me laiss√© une partie de ma vie sur ce jeu. Etant fan de l'univers Star Wars je ne pouvais pas passer √† c√¥t√© lors de sa sortie, je n'avais jamais touch√© un MMO √† part WOW pendant 2 petits mois d'essai et puis s'en va. J'avais d'abord accroch√© le mode histoire des diff√©rentes classes en solo (8 au total, 4 c√¥t√© r√©publique et 4 c√¥t√© Empire), puis ensuite j'ai pu rejoindre une guilde comme √ßa pour papoter et on a plus l√¢ch√© avec mes amis des 4 coins de la France, du Canada et de la Belgique, bref plus de vie IRL.Donc pour r√©sumer si vous voulez du solo ou du MMO et que vous aimez Star Wars vous pouvez y aller les yeux ferm√©s ^^Bon jeu √† tous !
Que puis-je dire de ce TransOcean √† part que c'est un jeu un peu bateau...Voila, voila...D√©sol√©...

Je vais laisser une √©valuation positive car je ne comprends pas comment on peut autant d√©tester ce jeu.Bon mon √©valuation sera uniquement sur les menus, car impossible de faire un match le jeu crash avant d'y acc√©der.Vraiment les devs ont fait un joli menu, si je met le stick vers la droite √ßa va √† droite, et encore plus fou si je vais √† gauche le stick va √† gauche aussi, et √ßa r√©pond rapidement c'est vraiment un menu fluide et √ßa fait plaisir !!On peu aussi modifier les param√®tres du jeu que l'on ne verra jamais, ce qui laisse une vrai imagination des graphismes, franchement bien pens√© dit donc.J'ai pu quand m√™me regarder 2KTV, tout n'est donc pas perdu non plus, du coup je suis trop impatient de voir la prochaine vid√©o, ils ont r√©ussi √† me rendre accro je n'attends plus que √ßa j'y pense tout le temps.Ah oui quand le jeu plante c'est quand on choisit un match, de cr√©er son √©quipe ou son joueur donc √©viter de choisir quelque chose √† faire et profitez de la musique et de ce merveilleux menu.Enfin pour finir le jeu crash proprement, on voit la tout le travail effectu√© par 2K, le retour √† windows est super propre, pas besoin de red√©marrage on se retrouve sur la page Steam comme si de rien √©tait en un √©clair. Franchement c'est beau j'ai pas de mots, du coup je peux reprendre ma vie de Geek.Ne soyez pas trop dur avec 2K, n'oubliez pas que chaque ann√©e c'est la gal√®re qu'au d√©but, c'est vrai aussi au milieu quelquefois et parfois √† la fin pour certain, mais ce menu est vraiment mega fluide, le meilleur menu depuis des ann√©es !!

J'ai vraiment h√©sit√© √† laisser une √©valuation positive, mais finalement oui car c'est un excellent jeu avec beaucoup d'action et un rythme soutenu tout au long du jeu. 3 types de zombie, Lickers, 2 types de Hunter, les Drain Demos qui remplacent les araign√©es, les chiens et le quasi immortel Nemesis le bestiaire est quand m√™me int√©ressant malgr√© les critiques.J'ai eu beaucoup de plaisir √† y jouer, peut-√™tre le meilleur RE dans l'action. Jill est vraiment Badass, elle assure et c'est vraiment plaisant de jouer ce genre de h√©ro √† la Lara Croft.Pas de moments de r√©flexion, c'est vraiment dommage car les √©nigmes m√™me facile sont dans l'ADN de RE. J'ai termin√© le jeu sans me presser ni tout d√©bloquer en 5 heures, c'est court !Des passages du jeu d'origine (1999) supprim√©s, mais pourquoi ? Si encore √† la place on aurait des temps de jeu sup√©rieur dans des zones existantes mais non m√™me pas, c'est triste.++++ Jill est trop Badass+++ Le rythme soutenu+++ Le Nemesis++ Le moteur du jeu+ Les passages avec Carlos-- Pas d'enigmes--- Des passages supprim√©s sans rien √† la place---- Beaucoup trop court pour un prix AAAEn bref je recommande ce jeu malgr√© tout, alors peut-√™tre pas √† ce prix car √ßa fait cher l'histoire solo, on paye le prix du multi qui vient s'ajouter avec Resistance et c'est dommageable. On a finalement l'impression que RE3 est un excellent "DLC" √† RE2 mais ce n'est pas le cas, il manque 3 bonnes heures pour en faire un tr√®s grand jeu, √ßa reste un bon jeu.

+++ Voir son Jedi devenir plus fort et ressentir cette progression est assez jouissif+++ L'histoire apr√®s l'ex√©cution de l'ordre 66++   Les combats en utilisant la force et son sabre++   L'exploration des plan√®tes, les phases sans combat est vraiment sympa+     Que du solo pour un Star Wars √ßa date-      La dur√©e de vie, environ 15 h pour la qu√™te principale, c'est court mais autant qu'un Tomb Raider (2013) ou qu'un Uncharted finalement.--     Pas de qu√™tes secondaires, juste des collectibles √† r√©cup√©rer, bien dommageDans l'ensemble un excellent jeu, si on est fan on ne peut qu'adorer (je ne comprend pas les "fans" qui n'aiment pas, ce ne sont sont que des imposteurs, misericorde on nous ment encore sacrebleu, bigre !!!). Il ne manque pas grand chose pour en faire un jeu extraordinaire, vraiment dommage, mais je recommande quand m√™me. Bon jeu √† ceux qui tente de se lier √† la force !

Un bon jeu dans l'ensemble qui √©volue avec des mises √† jour fr√©quentes, √ßa rappel un peu les √©missions de r√©novation que l'on peut regarder sur la TNT, √ßa aurait pu √™tre marrant d'acheter aux ench√®res nos maisons mais il y a d√©j√† un bon choix et r√©guli√®rement des ajouts.+++ Acheter une maison et la refaire++   De multiples possibilit√©s+     On am√©liore ses comp√©tences (un peu vite)-      Les cafards (j'aime pas les cafards)--     Un peu r√©p√©titif

Un excellent jeu d'ASOBO, tr√®s beau graphiquement avec une histoire prenante. Les deux personnages principaux sont attachant tout comme les personnages secondaires qui ont des sp√©cificit√©s utiles lors de certains passages du jeu. On se laisse vite guider et il est difficile de d√©crocher avant la fin. Le jeu est court mais peut √™tre aussi parce qu'il est bon, on ne s'ennuie pas une seule fois, et quand on le termine on est un peu orphelin lol.+++ L'univers sombre, la bande son (musique et doublage)++   Les personnages, Les graphismes+     Le gameplay, l'histoire-      L'IA parfois un peu b√™te--     Trop court, il faut compter entre 10 et 12 heures pour en venir √† bout

Apr√®s presque 200 h de jeu je laisse finalement une note n√©gative, je m'explique :Toujours les m√™mes d√©fauts depuis l'ajout des matchs 3D :- 3 voir 4 poteaux r√©guli√®rement lors des matchs, on est pourtant dans une simulation suppos√©e r√©aliste ??- Trop souvent des matchs √† 30 tirs √† 2 pour un r√©sultat de 0-2 ou 1-1 dans le meilleur des cas on peut le comprendre parfois mais pas √† presque tous les matchs !- Vendre un joueur c'est souvent brad√© dans un club moyen, aucune chance de vendre √† sa vrai valeur, par contre pour acheter un joueur moyen il faut surpayer 9 fois sur 10.Pourtant la base de donn√©e est √©norme, ce jeu pourrait √™tre une merveille avec ses nombreuses options, au final le plaisir de jeu n'existe plus on est plus souvent frustr√© qu'autre chose, vraiment dommage que ce soit des d√©fauts r√©currents et jamais corrig√© qui nuisent au jeu. Je n'achetais plus qu'un an sur 2 ces 4 derni√®res ann√©es √† cause de √ßa, je n'ach√®terais plus jamais dor√©navant, triste. A moins qu'un jour le nom soit modifi√© en Frustration Manager la au moins on sait ce que l'on ach√®te ^^

Je recommande :+++ Cr√©er sa propre √©curie en partant de rien++   Un Workshop tr√®s complet (Vrais noms, photos et sponsors, etc)++   Des r√®glements qui peuvent changer d'une saison √† l'autre avec un syst√®me de vote des managers+     Le seul jeu de management de F1 depuis tr√®s tr√®s longtemps-      Des n√©gociations de sponsors, de pilotes, de salari√©s plus pouss√©s auraient pu √™tre un plus (comme dans GP World √† l'√©poque)--     Peut paraitre r√©p√©titif √† la longue---   Des courses pas toujours coh√©rentes, nos coureurs terminent 1er et 2√®me puis la course d'apr√®s les 2 bons derniers, justifi√© par le fait que le circuit n'est pas fait pour notre chassis (Trop de diff√©rences)

Ok, so here's my two cents.. Overall, I like the idea behind this sim because who doesn't like building PCs, coming up with new builds, experimenting with various parts etc. BUT the problem is, that I feel like the sim gets bland very quickly way too soon. The free build mode is nice to try out different things and to see whether they are actually going to work and how the setup would look like. The campaign mode is also a pretty interesting idea to keep the whole thing fresh and exciting but tbh ... I really LOVE building PCs, doing something with my own hands and having the unbelievable excitement when you push the power button and it actually works. I realised pretty quickly that this cannot give me the same enjoyment - it doesn't even come close. Which is why I realised after only having one hour played that it is just not for me. Please don't get me wrong though. You can see that the devs put a lot of work and effort into this sim and I'm pretty confident that they'll keep improving stuff and adding new things. It just wasn't the right fit for me at a price tag of 20 bucks. There was nonetheless one thing I was wondering about.. I didn't really like the campaign mode personally but I thought that the free build is a pretty cool feature if you just want to try out a build (somewhat like a visualised version of pc partpicker). So I was wondering whether it would be possible to make the free build mode a standalone f2p mode (maybe funded through advertisements of hardware companies?!) for people who wanna get a feel and idea for their next build before they buy there new parts. I'd definitely use that every time I want to build a new PC. At the end of the day, I feel like this is a neat simulator with huge potential. While it just wasn't the right fit for me at the price tag of 20 EUR (since I didn't enjoy the campaign mode and the free build mode still seems a bit too limited atm), I still feel like it could be a cool experience for people into pc building or someone who's trying to get into pc building. Therefore, I'm leaving a thumbs up nonetheless.Curious where this will be in a couple of months. :)
pretty good so far. looking forward to what's coming in the future.

Well, what can I say? Playing this game ever since release has kinda been an emotional rollercoaster. Although I did uninstall the game multiple times, I always came back to it. I even wrote a pretty angry and disappointed review back in June last year and thought that I was done for good with the game. But even after a break of a couple of months, it managed to pull me back in again. I guess, if I wouldn't be able to still be playing the game with the same group of friends I started back when PUBG released, I wouldn't have come back in the first place, but I gotta say: I'm glad I did, since - to me - the game feels better than it ever did before. I totally agree that there are still major issues with the game and that it still is (and probably always will be) far from being a fully polished and perfect game, but it is nonetheless still the best BR out there and I'm happy Bluehole seems to actually be listening to their players again. Dear devs, the last couple of patches have been a HUGE improvement again - let's hope you can keep doing as well in the future! Many thanks for hundreds of hours of fun (mostly). <3P.S.: I do recommend playing this in squad mode with three friends (or at least duos with one of your mates) to get the most out of it.

The idea itself is pretty neat especially since PUBG is currently lacking a similar training mode and the core experience it offers for the low price is actually pretty solid. However, Battle Royale Trainer (BRT) still needs a lot of improvements to feel like an accurate training sim for this ever so popular genre. I guess although that it's referring to the genre Battle Royale itself, (looking at the design and weapon choices etc.) it's trying to offer a training mode specifically for PUBG-players. Therefore, my review is focused on the perspective of a PUBG-player, who might be interested in a training mode like this. TL;DR: Your best bet so far but nowhere near to the actual game. Needs a lot of tweaking or you won't see any improvements in your actual play style. 1. Weapons: The weapons need a lot of tweaking as they currently don't really feel anywhere close to the ones in PUBG. People have been talking about weapon spray etc. before but my main concern is with ballistics, bullet velocity etc. when practicing long-distance shots. My main problem currently with PUBG is that I most of the time don't get enough time to practice my sniping skills with the various weapons and scope combinations. I really do hope that in the future the devs are trying to bring the feel of the weapons inside BRT as close to PUBG as possible.2. Sound design: Although the sound design of PUBG is nowhere near perfect and has been complained about a lot in the past, it is still very crucial for these kind of games and should therefore also be accurately represented in BRT. Currently I am finding it very hard to track down shooters while being shot at and sometimes can't even locate them when I'm actually looking straight at them. ALSO: Please let me disable the main menu music!!!3. Visibility: I find it pretty hard to find any targets on the woodlands map - mostly due to the way shadows and lighting work atm and the map design itself. I think it probably needs a few adjustments regarding terrain (maybe more open fields with rocks as hiding spots and on the other hand less trees?). Also, how bout different map sizes or a map size that increases or decreases depending on how many bots you choose? Currently I find it pretty hard to track down any enemies on woodlands when I set the number very low to like 5 or 10.These were my initial thoughts. Overall, this is your best bet so far if you want to practice some BR-style shooting or simply warm up for PUBG outside of an actual round BUT it just feels too far away from the actual game atm, which raises doubts that you will gain any valuable skill improvements with its current state. I would give a neutral rating for now if that'd be possible on steam but I just can't recommend BRT in its current state. I will nonetheless keep revisiting it regularly to check out improvements and I'm pretty sure that the devs will be able to create something valuable for everyone if they keep listening to the players and adjust BRT accordingly. So long, take care and see you on the battleground!

Great game destroyed by shady monetization and questionable dev decisions.

OK, so I realise that most of the negative reviews are linked to the argument that there is not enough content that justifies the current price tag of this game. Although I have to admit that I was lucky enough to win this game during a twitter raffle, I can now - after nearly 18 hours of playtime - say that I don't think this is overpriced. Please bare in mind that I have never played Wanderlust: Rebirth so I can't tell whether there is much difference between both titles, but this game by itself is actually great fun and after nearly 18 hours I am still not bored of playing this, which is a good deal for a game at 11 quid, I'd say. Sure, the bosses on 'normal' difficulty are not the hardest, some NPCs tend to be imbalanced and you can play through the main story in about 7-8 hours. Nonetheless, you need to consider that there is so much more to this game than just the main story. There are actually quite a few dungeons hidden around the map with a lot of loot and their respective mini-bosses. Also, I am thrilled to find/craft the best gear possible as well as figuring out the best skill set for my character. Even if all that is not enough for you, you will be able to compete in the arena fights and although I thought, my character is already pretty awesome I am still miles a way from that 'round 20' achievement. Apart from singleplayer, I recently started to play this with some other guys and I think that's the most brilliant thing about this game. Raiding dungeons and fighting bosses is even more fun if you are in a group. I played a big chunk of the main story again right after I finished it in singleplayer and I enjoyed it even more. Especially, as one of the players showed us some dungeons that we hadn't heard of before. And then there is obviously also 'epic' difficulty to give you and your friends a bigger challenge (and better loot). Last but not least, I think it's great that the dev is still so engaged and keeps constantly releasing bugfixes. Sure, there are still some glitches and the game is not perfect but I am sure it will still be improved along the way.So overall, I can recommend this game as I really enjoyed it so far and I will definitely spend more time playing this. If you are not sure about the price and expect a 20+ hours story for your money, do not buy this (or wait until it's on offer)! But if you like pixel RPGs and want to have some fun with friends or on your own exploring this little entertaining indie title, go for it! I don't think you'll regret it.

First of all, please excuse my playtime. I had previously read the Japanese version of the game, and I wanted to first support the developers and people who worked on it and secondly, to write this review.I simply wanted to say that I had several breakdowns while playing this game. All of the heartbreaks and sorrow ensure that I will not forget the story (or stories) anytime soon. But it wasn't all tears and grief; you also got to laugh along the way as comic relief was sprinkled throughout. Regardless, the game can be very depressing at times, and while you may feel like all you're getting is suffering, I truly want you to persevere and make it to the finish. The finale may or may not be satisfying, but I found myself smiling at the end. I'm aware of the controversy around this release, I myself enjoy adult content in visual novels, hence I can see how it would deter people from buying this product.  But I do believe the story will make up for it.Lastly, I just wanna say that the vocal OST of this game is just amazing. Love all the OPs and EDs of all the cases! yuki is such an amazing vocalist! Also obligatory best girl (beside case-0) is Olivia for me!Now if only I could brainwash myself so that I could experience everything again...

If you've seen Shirobako, Ninki Seiyuu is similar in that it allows us to get a closer and more thorough look at how the things we love come to life. In this case specifically: seiyuus or voice acting. For the most part, the narrative was lighthearted and entertaining. Of course, there was drama here and there, but they did a nice job of not dragging it out too long. The characters were lovable, and the interaction between the casts was fantastic. Overall, the VN is surprisingly good, but I wish it could have been a little longer.The art style was what drew me to this VN. It is, without a doubt, quite appealing and attractive. I did some research on the artist and discovered that they've just worked on Ninki Seiyuu thus far. I genuinely hope they will begin working on a new project in the near future.Shiravune's team has been on fire lately, bringing us plenty of new titles. Although their translations might have been a little too liberal at times, I get the impression that the translating team is having a good time with it, and I appreciate their efforts. Keep up the good work, Shiravune!

When you read VNs to escape real life responsibilities, but the VN is about real life responsibilities: Does art imitate life, or does life imitate art?After my first playthrough, I believe I got the worst possible ending, and it's depressing. I despise what I'd made of MC, and I despise how I made choices for other characters without considering their feelings. You may scoff, but the story and its characters felt real to me because it was well written.I'm not sure if there's a happy ending in store for me, but I'm going to finish the game regardless.TL;DR: If you enjoy human drama and good music (and I mean really good music), read it and feel the same despair as I did.P/s: Also if you want to stream Dr. Flower music it's available on Spotify!

(I strongly advise reading printemps and √©t√© first before automne if you‚Äôre new to the series)  (This review contains spoilers!) After 2 years of waiting, we can once again go back to Saint Angraecum Academy; to the beautiful world of yuri that we all love and know too well. However,  Summer  has gone and along with it are the usual joyous feelings that we knew of... Autumn comes. Yuzuriha, the almighty and seemingly invincible president is the protagonist this time around. It wouldn‚Äôt be a stretch to call her the only Prince in the Academy. But it turns out that everything we knew in  Spring  and  Summer  was all but a facade that Yuzuriha put up to hide her own timidness and fragility. Yuzuriha, who seems like a hero that will save those in need of her help is in fact, the one who needs her very own hero instead.Nerine, the sweet and caring vice-president that we all have taken for granted. She has and will always be there when Yuzuriha needs her; Neri will always be the hero for Yuzuriha, yet this beautiful relationship has an ugly beginning and only Neri and Neri alone know. In her eyes she has manipulated and changed Yuzuriha so much that the guilt does not allow her to seek salvation. The only one who could free her from her own misery is none other than Yuzuriha.Autumn is a melancholy season. It‚Äôs the season of changes; people generally prefer status quo to changing something in their lives. But only through changes can we mature and better ourselves as a human being. Reading automne, to be perfectly honest, has been an angsty and bittersweet journey. It is nothing like printemps and √©t√©. But I‚Äôm glad I got to experience this. Erika, Chidori, Suoh, Rikka, Ringo, Ichigo. Everyone has grown so much ever since we met them in printemps. And last but not least, Yuzuriha and Neri, both have sacrificed so much for each other but it was well worth it. The ending was emotional and it really touched my heart. Finally, Winter has arrived. Again,  See everyone in 2 years ;~;

Now that I'm done with all the routes, time to write down a well-deserved review for this game.tl;dr:  With a wholesome and fulfilling story for each of the main heroines along with a great cast of supporting characters, Aokana is definitely one of the more safer choices when it comes to "What should I read next". The Story The story in Aokana is simple so it's quite easy to follow. In fact, for the most part it almost becomes too predictable. However, Aokana is not about the destination, it's about the journey. Throughout each route, you get to see not only the growth of the girl but Masaya (MC) himself; both as a FC player and a person. The Heroines Here's my brief opinion about each girl, as well as the route order I did for my playthrough and the route order I personally recommend:  Asuka  : Asuka is almost too pure and innocent; the same thing can be said about her love for the sport as well as her motivation. She can be ditzy at times but that's what's so charming about her. Also I can't stress how much I love random Asuka's noise.  Rika  : The friendly girl next door. Rika is kind and diligent but this is also her biggest weakest. Personally I think Rika's route is plain and is the weakest among the 4 but I don't dislike it. Sorry Rika's fans.  Mashiro  : At first I wasn't excited at all about her character cause it seemed like it wouldn't function properly without Misaki's support. But I'm glad I was wrong. Mashiro has the most touching story and she really is the best kouhai you could ask for.  Misaki  : Misaki is bae. That's all I have to say.I finished the game with that exact order. Now, If I were to recommend the order I think would be the best, it has to be Rika/Mashiro -> Asuka -> Misaki. Rika and Mashiro's stories are unrelated to the overall plot so you can choose whoever you want. Misaki should be played last so you can truly experience her character development.  R18 Patch I don't really know why but I gotta make a dedicated section for this.There is a free patch up on NekoNyan's official website if you wish to restore the hscenes to your steam version of the game. At first I really thought that it wasn't necessary to play Aokana with hscenes restored as weird as it may sound. I went with Asuka route first and for the most part the story revolved heavily around FC and sport in general so the romance aspect of the game wasn't at all prominent. Naturally this makes Asuka hscene kinda forced and it felt like they have it for the sake of having it. Rika and Mashiro didn't get much better treatment either. Misaki however, this I can approve of. Again, as weird as it sounds, Misaki route has a proper eroge feel to it so her hscene makes sense. At this point I know I'm not making any sense but if you make it this far thank you.  In conclusion I think Aokana is great and you can't really go wrong with picking this up. Special shout-out to our adorable manager Madoka who makes every scene she appears in 10x more interesting!

Normally I don't do reviews this early in a game but I feel it's necessary this time. First off this is a good game and fun to play once you get use to the controls and how they work. It's a bit wonky at first but you get the hang of it pretty quick. Now for my reason to do an early review...there was a big problem with starting the game with my product key. I had to insert a patch manually to get this thing working. If anyone has this problem I can help you get it working so feel free to contact me if your having trouble. It's not super difficult but does require you to manually insert a patch into your game files and do a bit of computer skills. Other than that the game is pretty good!UPDATE: I also noticed that my achievements are not showing up but I can clearly see them in-game! Well I went in and did a little more tweaking and now the achievements are starting to show up. Also I'm having some crashing issues but just minor which I think I can also fix. I don't think the Devs worry about the game anymore but even with all the work I had to do it's still a game worth playing!

I'll start off by saying it is very short but made like a prologue type game. It has a good story line and the voice acting is decent. Apparently there is going to be a part II which I'm looking forward to. Overall it's a neat little jem that rather teases you and definitely has you wanting more.

Du teamplay objectif tr√®s nerveux o√π la mobilit√©, strat√©gie et le savoir-jouer sont √† l'honneur ! Une trinit√© Heal / DPS / Technicien  avec un choix de mercenaires et donc d'armes et de comp√©tence fait que l'on s'ennuie pas et qu'on peut parer √† n'importe qu'elle situation. On y rajoute un syst√®me de sets d'armements pour les mercenaires, avec niveau de raret√© histoire de passer plus d'heures sur le jeu.Les graphismes et l'ambiances sont agr√©ables, l'optimisation est l√† et on est sur du jeu stable sans b√©mol. Pour les points n√©gatifs ( parce que on ne m'a pas pay√© pour cette review ) :- Jeu en B√™ta depuis 2 ans, et les patchs, MaJ et nouveaux contenus mettent beaucoup de temps √† arriver- Syst√®me de ranked encore en Alpha- Leveling du compte dans ce jeu assez fastidieux- Communaut√© r√©duite : le jeu est trop m√©connu √† mon go√ªt, je m'√©tonnerais toujours de l'absence de Marketing et de ne pas voir plus de joueurs. Quand on voit que CSGO avec une map et 10 armes tiens des millions de joueurs par jour, √ßa me fait mal au c≈ìur que des jeux comme √ßa restent dans l'ombre.Au final, je recommande fortement ce FPS qui efface les pyjamas de Call Of Duty au profit d'un jeu centr√© en √©quipe et tactique assez original.

Hey hey ~Je vous retrouve ici pour vous donner une √©valuation objective sur les points les plus importants de ce jeu, pouvant justifier pour vous son achat, ou pas.Note : j'ai achet√© le jeu au cours des Summer Sales pour 20$ et ai attendu de le finir deux fois pour pouvoir partager efficacement un ressenti complet.Point 1 : HistoireAlors l'histoire.. Quelque chose qui me semble important dans un jeu de ce type. Je vais √™tre direct, c'est mitig√©. On √† une trame assez classique : grand vilain sur derni√®re mission, et avant lui on va rendre visite √† tout ses lieutenants et hommes de main les uns apr√®s les autres. Rien de bien original, mais efficace normalement.  Alors quoi? Pourquoi c'est mitig√©?...C'est plat. Vraiment plat. On incarne pas Emily ou Corvo, mais Superman. On va aller descendre les lieutenants les uns apr√®s les autres sans difficult√©s, sans p√©rip√©ties entre, sans rebondissements, sans une √©corchure ( parce que j'ai v√©rifi√©, j'ai port√© le m√™me costume du d√©but √† la fin de l'histoire, il est pas d√©chir√©, ni sale, et pourtant une des missions se passe √† Poussi√®reville ). C'est assez exasp√©rant de voir que l'Imp√©ratrice perd son tr√¥ne et le regagne en 9 jours avec un ratio d'un jour = 1 m√©chant et ses 65 gardes.  Pas une seule fois on se fait chopper, enfermer, capturer ou perdre un doigt. Pas une seule fois un de ces lieutenants se met en √©tat d'alerte suite aux √©v√©nements des missions pr√©c√©dentes pour nous proposer autre chose qu'une ligne droite. 9 missions, 9 lieutenants qui jouent avec le canard en plastique dans le bain sans nous voir sur la poutre du plafond.Pour r√©sumer, la trame principale est un sprint, et ce n'est pas un 100m haies. C'est bien plat. PLAT._________________________________________________________________________N√©anmoins, un point important que je tiens √† souligner et qui fait du bien au lore, c'est les documents et infos. Partout dans toutes les missions : livres, lettres, cartes, audios et autres sauront sustenter les plus curieux, vont nous faire apprendre beaucoup de choses au niveau de la situation, des personnages, du pass√©, et aussi nous donner de nombreux indices de missions donnant lieu √† des possibilit√©s alternatives. Le tout dans un bon gros porte-documents que l'on √† toujours sur soi, des archives probablement conserv√©es dans le vide vu leur taille, accessibles √† n'importe quel moment. C'est un vrai plaisir de fouiner dans la vie des gens et de se dire que cette lettre trouv√©e sur ce bureau nous √† fait comprendre comment cette personne en est arriv√©e l√†.Point 2 : GameplayJe mentionnais √ßi-dessus l'alternativit√©. Je pense que c'est la cl√© de vo√ªte de ce jeu. √ânorm√©ment de choix √† faire, de mani√®res de proc√©der, de chemins √† trouver sur les maps.. Tout est une harmonieuse tapisserie qui se tisse entre le niveau de chaos que l'on g√©n√®re, nos choix sur les objectifs de missions, notre fa√ßon de r√©agir aux situations, le choix des pouvoirs ( ils nous orientent r√©ellement sur un gameplay ). C'est une satisfaction √©galement de voir √† la mission suivante ce que nos choix ont engendr√©s comme changements. M√™me les conversations des civils entre eux ( si il en reste ) d√©pendront de vos actions.C√¥t√© gameplay, recette propre √† Dishonored : pouvoirs, charmes d'os modifiants des particularit√©s, le mode de combat n'a pas chang√©, la furtivit√© non plus. Le nouveau sera seulement la possibilit√© de craft ses propres charmes d'os, nous poussant encore plus intens√©ment dans notre choix de Gameplay et pouvant √† la longue faire de nous un personnage sous GodMod.Point 3 : GraphismesLes graphismes, autre point noir au tableau, √† c√¥t√© de la trame principale aussi plate que la ville de Grenoble. Ils sont bien √©videmment agr√©ables et assez pouss√©s, surtout au niveau des ombres et √©clairages qui donnent le ton et font partie int√©grante de l'ambiance de ce jeu. Malheureusement c'est tr√®s ( trop ) gourmand, et mal optimis√©. Les plus grosses configs peinent √† atteindre leurs 60 FPS en √âlev√©. Autant dire que pour les moyennes ou basses configs, vous cracherez sur les graphismes du jeu et vous contenterez du gameplay, faute de quoi l'explosion d'une mine pourra engendrer un crash pour vous !Point 4 : Long√©vit√©Malgr√®s l'histoire lin√©aire en 9 missions, le jeu sera √©tonnement long si vous vous y int√©ressez :- Fins et objectifs alternatifs √† foison- Nombre de secrets, pouvoirs, documents compl√©tant le lore diss√©min√©s sur la map, faisant passer le temps de mission de 30min √† 1-2h- Nombreuses fa√ßons de faire et proc√©der- Possible de jouer en refusant les pouvoirs ( tr√®s int√©ressant comme exp√©rience )- Plusieurs niveaux de difficult√©- Possibilit√© de NewGame +, ce qui est int√©ressant pour monter en difficult√©Point 5 : Recommandation?Alors en r√©sum√©, on √† une histoire sympa mais qui se passe malheureusement trop bien, rehauss√© par un lore foisonnant et beaucoup de r√©v√©lations. Le gameplay ne change pas, il est rest√© ce pourquoi on aime Dishonored. La multitude de fa√ßon de proc√©der ainsi que les choix et l'alternativit√© est passionnant et tr√®s accrocheur. Cela jouera √©videmment dans une long√©vit√©, qui ne se mesure pas aux nombre de missions composant le jeu, mais √† tout ce qu'il y'a √† d√©couvrir et essayer. Pour les graphismes, c'est dommage pour 80% des gens qui ach√®teront ce jeu, ils n'en profiteront pas pleinement et c'est regrettable car c'√©tait une bonne plus-value.Ce jeu offre de bons moments, est accrocheur mais l'histoire trop plate et l'optimisation l‚Äôentache. Je le recommande car il fera partie de la culture vid√©o-ludique, mais le prix de 19$ pendant les Summer Sales √©tait plus justifi√©.  A prendre Sold√© donc !

Really good remake of the original Half Life. Authentic but extended / adapted where the original had flaws. Haven't got to the new Xen levels yet, but looking forward to this. Would recommend as probably the best way to experience the HL1 story nowadays.

Nice puzzle game. Simply presented but enjoyable.

I've only really scratched the surface of this game at the moment, but it has been enjoyable so far, and there is enough guidance for it not to feel totally overwhelming. The developers have also given this game a lot of love over the past year or so, with several nice looking updates.
Clever, original and quite unsettling.

An excellent platformer, with a great 'feel' and excellent level design. Even though the game is hard you can still progress without being the greatest player. Lots of levels, unlockables and so on. A classic.

This is what indie games are all about for me. The game is fairly short, and the individual components are all quite straightforward, but the presentation, the way they are put together and the manipulation / social engineering are amazing and very original. In particular, one part will stay with me as a unique gaming experience for a long time.
Amazingly atmospheric game - I think the sounds are a large part of this. Very much a piece of art, but also a good puzzle platform game. Only downsides are that it is pretty gloomy, and quite short.

Nicht wirklich gut.Die Spielwelt ist langweilig. Diese sieht sehr trostlos und eint√∂nig aus. Es gibt kein Wettereffekte sowie keine beweglichen Objekte wie zum Beispiel im Wind taumelnde B√§ume. Auch sind so gut wie alle Objekte in der Spielwelt statisch. Daher, ich fahre mich einem dicken Jeep gegen einen kleinen Wagen mit voller Geschwindigkeit und was passiert, genau, man bremst von Topspeed of 0 Km/H ab. Die H√§user sowie Scheunen etc. sehen alle gleich aus.Fahrzeuge kleben auf dem Asphalt, wodurch man st√§ndig in Neigungen und Schluchten gegen kleine Bergkanten knallt und nicht wie erwartet durch die Beschleunigung springt, dr√ºber fliegt. Ihr wisst was ich meine ;)Die Gegner Vielfalt ist recht gering. Kann man an einer Hand abz√§hlen. Charaktere sind lieblos. Das Baumen√º ist un√ºbersichtlich und √ºberfordert durch die nicht vorhandene Einf√ºhrung in die Funktionsweise. Mit der Zeit hat man aber den dreh raus. Der Koop Modus ist leider auch bescheiden. Ich als Host habe alles zu entscheiden. Meine Mitspieler k√∂nnen Loot einsameln und abliefern, mehr nicht. Zudem muss man st√§ndig Ingame nahe zusammen bleiben, da wenn man sich zu weit voneinander entfernt, die Multiplayer Session getrennt wird.Die Missionen sind durchweg alle gleich aufgebaut. Sammle das ein, bringe es von A nach B. Erschie√üe diese Person, besorge dieser Information. Und das geht immer so weiter.Ich k√∂nnte etliche weitere Punkte aufz√§hlen. Insgesamt ist dieser Titel sehr entt√§uschend und nicht empfehlenswert.

Nun was soll ich sagen. Das Spiel sieht gut aus. Sound ist klasse. Die Vertonung super. Es wird nichts wiederholt (Die Unterhaltungen). aMAZING GAME!! Love the story, gameplay, music, scary vibe, russian setting, characters and everything else, the Metro series has turned in to one of my favorite series really quickly. Wish I played this game much, much sooner, definitely going to get last light and exodus on PS4!

A fun, relaxing and eazy game to download and play, if your an achievement hunter (like me) you can easily get all the achievements in just 1 hour max, and in the meantime enjoy a beatifully created game. Its a really nice gesture from the devs to have this game as FREE, I would definitely buy the game too if they put a price tag on it. To keep this short, I would highly recommend you to download this game, its a really fun and well designed game, with amazing gameplay and amazing music :)! Great game from the Devs :)!Would HIGHLY recommend this game :)!8,7/10

Fun little story based game that references a lot back to the good old days, the game is fun to play and really touches your emotions during the game and especially during the end. You basically start off by creating a MSN account and then chatting to a good friend of urs whose called emily, you start chatting about random things etc. And basically from there on start a story! Would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes a fun little story game (takes about 1 hour).I only have 1 con about this game and I think I should mention it in my review.  basically this game has only 1 ending I won't spoil it but there isn't much you can do to change the ending and that really is the only bad thing about this game But other than that I would highly recommend this game I mean it's a free game so why the heck not?9.1/10

Amazing and Fun little Management game where you basically have to manage and build your own Tower, by adding offices, restaurants, getting people to work in your tower to earn money for you, keeping everyone as happy as possible etc. This game might seem difficult at first but when you play the tutorials first (before you actually go in and start ur own tower) u can get alot of help from it and now the basics and stuff, from there on you can go and do whatever you want and build your own tower :)! The art style of the game is pretty unique haven't really seen a game this typ-ish, thats what makes it fun and amazing to play, also the music is pretty calming too and actually fun to listen at, everything else in the game is in my opinion well made too, the things you can add to ur tower etc!Too keep this review short i can say that this game is a MUST have to people who like management and building type of games, this would be perfect for you :)! Also for people who are wanting to buy a management/building game for the first time, i would highly recommend this one :)!9,3/10 Worth Buying :)!

Really amazing and fun Indie typish game, The game is very easy to play and learn, it will get harder tho the more days you make but that doesn't really matter because it is easy to learn it and use the new things, also this game has some parts where there are people coming to ur booth and asking u to do them a favor or etc. or let them pass etc. and its up to you to make the decision to let them pass and risk getting a strike or deny them, this game gets ur feelings tho, because some choices are hard.But anyways i would highly recommend this game :)!, REALLY FUN and AMAZING :)! Definitely worth Playing.10/10 GLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRYYYY TO ARSTOTZKA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
good game
Fine little game.. kinda DayZ and Roblox smashed together.. would recommend the game if u need a free to play game.. then this is a good game...

Very good game.. u have to react fast to the ball, when u have learned to fly.. it would be alot more funnier cuz then u can score from the air and could make a very hard goal to save. very fun to play, u can learn new people.. if i could rate this game from 1 - 10. It would be a 10.
The good thing about this game is that its free and everyone plays this, great work from the developers, i would give it 9.5/10!
Playing this with friends RN!

OH BOY WHERE DO I START WITH THIS GAME! Tbh this is one of my top 20 games that I have every played with friends. Me and my friends will play this game for hours at a time. This type of game is one of those mindless sit back and chill.The worst thing that I can really say about this game is that once you play and beat it once that's it. The levels repeat for every game and each session is about 30 - 40 min long. When you beat all of the levels I recommend using some game changes like what guns can drop or if only one type of gun drops,For the price of the game i can not recommend it enough.

This is a well rounded game, it is a grind tho so be ready for that BUT it is very easy to pick up and start playing. 8/10 The reason for the 8/10 is for how long you have to grind keep in mind I have been gaming when I was 2 so I know a thing or two about gaming. It took me around 45-50 min to get to LV.8. At the rate the game goes it would take to a long time to get to a stable level (FOR A SOMEONE WHO IS NEW TO THE GAME). I also did use my skill point's to up the drop rates and XP boosters. All in all the game is very fun and addicting I would play this game to relax, this is a game that got the raw end of the stick. I feel that it should be viewed with Minecraft & Terraria.  But I would strongly say DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE!!! The only reason for this statement is that for the game  at face value is just a Minecraft clone. I still stand by what I said with having it up there with MC and Terraria but  the only new features that this game has is a RPG mechanic and a get money/XP to progress threw out the game mechanic.  BUT DO CONSIDER ON BUYING THE GAME!!!I just want to say that this is my own appinion.
meh

This is a very fun game.It tells the one piece story not well but not bad ether. I recommend reading/watching one piece if you want the story. This is a very fun hack and slash type game. It's basted off of the dynasty warriors franchise and has the same mechanics as One Piece Pirate Warriors 3.I can't recommend this game enough. If you are thinking about buying it you should. This game is not for everyone but it is a very fun anime game. (NOTE YOU NEED A CONTROLLER FOR THIS GAME TO WORK WELL... AS IN IT IS P I SS HARD TO PLAY WITH A KEYBOARD AND MOUSE.)

This game is so fun.You can have endless fun with the campaign.You can customize your character in so many ways. You can just go crazy there is a huge modding community out there for this game as well.But you can'r play with anyone when you have mod's enabled. Other than that this game is great and you should go buy it.

This is such a fun game. I am a big retro synth wave fan and this game checked all the marks.1. You can just vibe to this game.2. You get some bad a s s screenshots.3. There is a lot of active dev's.4. This can make your profile look like the sh i t.I just want to say thank you to the dev's for this game.

If you like assassin's creed 4 black flag than you will love this game. This game barrows heavy and I mean heavy almost on point game play mechanics from black flag.Well it is kind of like a part 2 to that game.As you play the game you will love the parkour and meany other free run game play mechanics.The pirate ship is a bit crap because you can lose control of the ship very fast. But that is not a huge issue. There is crafting in this game and that does suck a lot I did mange to get all of the animal hides but it was impossible to do at first. When you have a little bit of unlocks under your belt you are going to love every seconded of this game.There is some glitches in the game engine but you almost never notice them.All and all this game is a very good secondary assassin's creed story game.

When I was younger I loved one piece and I still do today this is a fun arcade style fighting game. It has a street fight vibe to it that is fun and enjoy able and that does not stop the skill ceiling of the game.If you have fun with arcade games of this nature with a bit of a twist to some mechanics (because it's one piece so it uses one piece story mechanics like devils fruit powers) than don't let that stop you from buying this game.I have had this game for 4 years (AS LONG AS I HAVE HAD MY STEAM ACCOUNT) All and all this game has a timeless art style and a even more time less story and game play.NOTE YOU NEED A CONTROL FOR A GOOD GAME PLAY EXPERIENCE!!!!That is something people don't tell you.

This game is very fun I don't have a hole lot of hours on it but...Rage 2 borrows heavy game play elements for the 1st title.This is a bit more of an hyper energy fallout 3. Yes it is rocky at times with it's rpg grind aspect but that does not take away from the fun.
